poem:
Title: "Upon Arizona's Dark Day"

Through the desert's hibernal horn,
'Tis Arizona that forlorn:
Its ladies, in twilight thrown,
Their choices usurped, freedoms hewn.

Though Stanton stands in shadows wide,
The architect's face is not to hide.
A heavy bell in court does chime,
Silenced hearts in sorrow's time.

Crows' caws carry a defiant cry,
As in the west, the dark descends nigh.
